it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Client.CLI

Class ClientCLI

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Client.CLI.ClientCLI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientInterface, KillableRunnable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientCLI
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientInterface, KillableRunnable
    the main thread which handle all the command line interface interaction. It's main scope is to open context when a CONTEXT message has been received, to send message coming from contexts and to offer methods (ClientCLI implements ClientInterface interface) avaiable from external classes to interact with the player. It also has all the references to the client-model classes, in order to print them on the screen.
    • boardReference: the ClientBoard
    • playerListReference: the player list connected to the game
    • playerUUID: the UUID of this player
    • gameUUID: the UUID of the game the player is playing on
    • contextList: the list of all available contexts
    • zeroLevelContextThread: reference to the ZeroLevelContext thread
    • contextQueue: the queue containing all the CONTEXT messages sent to the client. Every message in this queue will open a single context
    • messageQueue: the queue containing all the messages which must be displayed
    • sendQueue: the queue used to send message from the CLI threads
    • clientsendQueue: the queue used from contexts to send messages to the server
    • in: scanner handling the input stream
    • out: printWriter handling the output stream
    • idleRun: flag which indicates if ZeroLevelContext must be activated
    • wait: flag which indicates if player must wait his turn. If so, the action menu can't be activated
    • leaderStartPhase: flag which indicates if the leader card distributing phase is ended or not
    • stop: use this flag to stop this thread

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        run() method continuosly check if there are context to open or message to display or to send. When no of this action can be performed ZeroLevelContextThread is launched and stopped when one of the previous condition is satisfied.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
